function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Use of outdated search databases up to november 2006","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High incidence rates of respiratory viruses during major epidemics worldwide","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Serious pandemic viral infections such as sars and avian influenza","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of single measures such as vaccines or antivirals in interrupting the spread of influenza","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Privacy concerns and surveillance societies related to big data analytics","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability of urban big data to capture underlying cause-effect relationships","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need for understanding human behavior at individual and collective levels","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear and targeted messaging in different regions","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on complex multidimensional mobility index data","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid development of data resource without comprehensive planning","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Open collaboration between research institutions and public authorities may lead to unfiltered or unverified data being used in decision-making processes.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of division of agreed goals between research institutions and public authorities may lead to conflicting priorities and objectives in the development of public monitoring programmes.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proactive agile development of the covid-19 dashboard without proper planning may result in incomplete or inaccurate data representation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Abnormal concentrations of traffic outside supermarkets and health-care facilities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Capture of changing patterns of traffic, pedestrian, and other activity away from the city centre.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in air pollution and improvement in environmental indices such as nitrogen dioxide.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of data integration for specific covid-19 impacts","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Observing social change without clear action plan","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large-scale real-time data capture infrastructure may pose privacy risks if data is not anonymized effectively.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close collaboration with local authorities and citizen partners may increase the risk of disease transmission if proper health and safety measures are not followed.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Publication of real-time urban movement data and covid-19 dashboard may lead to public panic or misinformation if not presented and interpreted accurately.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neoliberal surveillance mechanism through big data","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 crisis management using iot and smart city data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of covid-19 transmission in the workplace due to close interaction among workforce, design team, contractors, clients, stakeholders, and supply chain.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Short-term cash flow issues due to economic lockdown and reduced business activities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the business return plan due to evolving covid-19 situation and economic consequences.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of cross-sector collaboration","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of crisis management skills","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of crisis-response leadership programs","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to cultural change","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential delay of infrastructure projects","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of research results","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of communication and employee well-being considerations","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 on infrastructure projects and staff members","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty conducting drugs and alcohol tests for new staff","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prevalence of covid-19 in the built environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential economic collapse","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unanimous implementation of solutions not achieved in organisations a and c","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited work from home periods for employees during lockdown","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of preparedness for unexpected outbreaks such as covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Construction workers being exposed to the virus due to close contact and shared workspaces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited availability of virus testing for workers within the uk","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in adjusting commercial terms and place of work requirements to comply with safety obligations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 from suppliers delivering materials to construction sites.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced workforce on site may impact the ability to deliver projects as promised, leading to potential delays and client dissatisfaction.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of social distancing in site offices and vans","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of technology and mobile phones for remote work","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in supply chain and accommodation provision for construction workers","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hiring new staff members during a pandemic without in-person interviews and induction process.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
